reviewtext: I have multiple areas with music systems and five of these Pioneer changers; three of the older F1007 and two of the F1009.  They are all at least 10 years old with never a problem.  The F1007's are actually better in that they can be daisy-chained although unlike the 400 disc changers made by Sony (I have two of those also) it won't play a cd's automatically between the two changers.Unlike a previous reviewer, I think the remote is one of the best features.  It has one button random play plus a "favorites" function to set up a special play list which is also just a one button operation.I'm migrating to a digital system only because I have more cd's than the systems can handle, but if that isn't an issue, I highly recommend.
